docs.snippet: Shares in U.S. exporters of everything from planes to tractors were volatile on Wednesday after China proposed duties on key U.S. imports including soybeans, planes, cars, beef and chemicals in retaliation to Trump administration tariff plans.

headline.print_headline: China Trade Retaliation Puts Stocks of U.S. Exporters in Spin
headline.main: China Trade Retaliation Puts Stocks of U.S. Exporters in Spin

docs.snippet: China's manufacturing activity expanded at its weakest pace in four months in March as export demand faltered, prompting companies to shed staff more quickly as they looked to cut costs, a private survey showed on Monday.

headline.print_headline: China March Factory Growth Cools to Four-Month Low-Caixin PMI
headline.main: China March Factory Growth Cools to Four-Month Low-Caixin PMI

docs.snippet: California Gov. Jerry Brown on Friday pardoned five ex-convicts facing deportation, including two whose families fled the Khmer Rouge regime in Cambodia four decades ago.

headline.print_headline: California Governor Pardons 5 Men Facing Deportation
headline.main: California Governor Pardons 5 Men Facing Deportation

docs.snippet: As the Senate majority leader holds up reform of the congressional disciplinary process, 22 senators say, enough.

headline.main: Mitch McConnell, Your Female Colleagues Are Fed Up

docs.snippet: Campaigning for Mexico's elections officially begins on Friday, with a left-wing candidate who promises to clean up politics and reduce the country's dependence on the United States leading all major opinion polls for the presidency.

headline.print_headline: Factbox-Mexico's Presidential Candidates at the Start of Campaigning
headline.main: Factbox-Mexico's Presidential Candidates at the Start of Campaigning

docs.snippet: Negative partisanship is taking us somewhere we haven’t been for a very long time.

headline.print_headline: What Motivates Voters More Than Loyalty? Loathing
headline.main: What Motivates Voters More Than Loyalty? Loathing

docs.snippet: Wall Street surged on Thursday, bringing an upbeat end to a tumultuous, holiday-shortened week as technology stocks rebounded, but the S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their biggest quarterly declines in more than two years.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Stocks Jump in Upbeat End to Tumultuous Quarter
headline.main: U.S. Stocks Jump in Upbeat End to Tumultuous Quarter

docs.snippet: Ian Khama, a retired army general, stepped down as president of Botswana on Saturday, handing the diamond-rich country to his deputy after a decade at the helm.

headline.print_headline: Botswana's Khama Steps Down as President After a Decade at Helm
headline.main: Botswana's Khama Steps Down as President After a Decade at Helm

docs.snippet: Campaigning for Mexico's elections officially begins on Friday, with a left-wing candidate who promises to clean up politics and reduce the country's dependence on the United States leading all major opinion polls for the presidency.

headline.print_headline: Factbox: Mexico's Presidential Candidates at the Start of Campaigning
headline.main: Factbox: Mexico's Presidential Candidates at the Start of Campaigning

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
